description:
What kinds of humour endure over time? This course examines the
different genres of humour in ancient literature and their
corresponding forms today: political satire in Attic comedy; sitcoms
in Hellenistic comedy; farce in Roman comedy; âstand upâ in first
person Roman satire. What does comedy tell us about the dynamics
of power and gender in ancient cultures and today?
title: Ancient Humour: Greece and Rome
prerequisite:
YCC1111 Literature and Humanities 1, YCC1112 Literature and
